Draw a line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.2158, 0.0). 2. Draw an arc with a start point at (0.2158, 0.0), a mid point at (0.75, 0.1875), and an end point at (0.2158, 0.375). 3. Draw a line from point (0.2158, 0.375) to point (0.0, 0.375). 4. Close the loop by drawing a line from point (0.0, 0.375) to point (0.0, 0.0). Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector Transform the scaled 2D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1125, 0.0] Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.5625 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 Step 6: Add the part to the CAD assembly Add the part to the CAD assembly as a new solid body. Summary The final shape of this part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The prism has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.5625</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with zero rotation and translation. 1. Sketching the Base Face: - Create a new sketch on the XY plane. - Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: ``` (0, 0), (0.375, 0), (0.375, 0.125), (0, 0.125), (0, 0) ``` This rectangle consists of 4 straight lines. 2. Scale the Sketch: - Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 about the origin. 3. Extruding the Sketch: - Extrude the sketch by 0.125 units along the positive Z-axis. - Assign the 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' boolean operation. Part 2 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.375, 0.25, 0) with zero rotation. 1. Sketching the Base Face: - Create a new sketch on the XY plane. - Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: ``` (0, 0), (0.375, 0), (0.375, 0.125), (0, 0.125), (0, 0) ``` This rectangle consists of 4 straight lines. 2. Scale the Sketch: - Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.375 about the origin. 3. Extruding the Sketch: - Extrude the sketch by 0.25 units along the positive Z-axis. - Assign the 'JoinFeatureOperation' boolean operation. Part 3 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the sides is equal. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.375, 0, 0) with zero rotation. 1. Sketching the Base Face: - Create a new sketch on the XY plane. - Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: ``` (0, 0), (0.375, 0), (0.375, 0.125), (0, 0.125), (0, 0) ``` This rectangle consists of 4 straight lines. 2. Scale the Sketch: - Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.375 about the origin. 3. Extruding the Sketch: - Extrude the sketch by 0.25 units along the positive Z-axis. - Assign the 'JoinFeatureOperation' boolean operation.</description>
